isis.stitle: ELECTRICAL SYSTEM TROUBLESHOOTING GUIDE - 5000, 9100, 9200, 9400, AND 9900 MODELS - CAB ACCESSORIES - OPERATION - Electric Windshield Wipers - Intermittent Wipe And Wash

svcproc.title: Electric Windshield Wipers - Intermittent Wipe And Wash

svcsubproc.title: Wiper Operation
svcsubproc.para: Refer to ELECTRIC WINDSHIELD WIPER WITH INTERMITTENT WIPE AND WASH circuit diagram in CTS-5119W or CTS-5273W.
Low Speed Wiper Operation -With the wiper switch in the low position, power from terminal 5 is applied internally to terminal 2, then through circuit 82E to the low speed winding in the wiper motor.

High Speed Wiper Operation -With the wiper switch in the high position, power from terminal 5 is applied internally to terminal 6, then through circuit 82D to the high speed winding in the wiper motor. Note that power from 5 is not applied to terminals 3 and 4 in the high speed position, so power is not applied to the low speed winding.

Park Operation -Note that power is always present (with key on) at P terminal of crank motor. When the wipers are operating, the circuit between wiper motor P and S is closed. In this position, power at P goes through contacts and out S, through the normally closed contacts of the wiper relay (143) and back to the wiper switch at terminal 1. From terminal 1, the power goes through terminal 2 to the low speed winding and the motor continues to operate until the park switch rotates, opening the circuit between terminal S and P, and closing the circuit between S and X, parking the wipers and turning off operation. With the key on or off, battery power is always present at the common terminal 30 of wiper intermittent relay (142). When the key is on, the relay is energized and supplies power from the normally open terminal 87 for all wiper and washer operations. Power is applied to wiper switch (431) at terminal 5.

svcsubproc.title: Intermittent Wiper And Washer Operation
svcsubproc.para: The intermittent wiper and washer switches are part of switch assembly (432).

Intermittent Wiper Operation -With ignition key on, setting the intermittent switch applies power from switch terminal C through circuit 82J to energize the wiper motor relay. With the wiper motor relay energized, power from relay (142) passes through the wiper motor relay (143) and through the circuit 82H to the wiper motor switch at terminal 1. With the wiper switch in the off position, the power passes through the switch (terminal 1 to 2) and is applied through circuit 82E to the low speed motor winding. When the intermittent switch contacts open, wiper motor relay (143) de-energizes, power is turned off to the wiper switch, and the wiper motor operates until it reaches the park position.

Windshield Washer Operation -Depressing the washer switch, which is part of switch (432), energizes the windshield washer pump and energizes the wiper motor relay (143). This causes the wipers to operate in the intermittent mode.
